title: ICE: compiler/rustc_symbol_mangling/src/legacy.rs, finding type for DefId(...), encountered def-id DefId(...) with no parent

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: F-rustc_attrs
labels.description: Internal rustc attributes gated on the `#[rustc_attrs]` feature gate.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(rustc_attrs)] #[rustc_symbol_name] use std::ops; ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.53.0-nightly (74874a690 2021-03-30) binary: rustc commit-hash: 74874a690bc95443292496ff5df5cc5c8cb56e0b commit-date: 2021-03-30 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.53.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` warning: unused import: `std::ops` --> perses_node_priority_with_dfs_delta_reduced_mutant.rs:3:5 | 3 | use std::ops; | ^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(unused_imports)]` on by default error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_symbol_mangling/src/legacy.rs:41:21: finding type for DefId(0:3 ~ perses_node_priority_with_dfs_delta_reduced_mutant[8787]::{misc#1}), encountered def-id DefId(0:0 ~ perses_node_priority_with_dfs_delta_reduced_mutant[8787]) with no parent thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/74874a690bc95443292496ff5df5cc5c8cb56e0b/library/std/src/panic.rs:59:5 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.53.0-nightly (74874a690 2021-03-30) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type staticlib query stack during panic: #0 [symbol_name] computing the symbol for `{misc#1}` end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error; 1 warning emitted ```
Backtrace

``` warning: unused import: `std::ops` --> perses_node_priority_with_dfs_delta_reduced_mutant.rs:3:5 | 3 | use std::ops; | ^^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(unused_imports)]` on by default error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_symbol_mangling/src/legacy.rs:41:21: finding type for DefId(0:3 ~ perses_node_priority_with_dfs_delta_reduced_mutant[8787]::{misc#1}), encountered def-id DefId(0:0 ~ perses_node_priority_with_dfs_delta_reduced_mutant[8787]) with no parent thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/74874a690bc95443292496ff5df5cc5c8cb56e0b/library/std/src/panic.rs:59:5 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: std::panic::panic_any 2: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::bug 3: rustc_errors::Handler::bug 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt 5: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 7: rustc_symbol_mangling::legacy::mangle 8: rustc_symbol_mangling::symbol_name_provider 9: rustc_query_impl:: for rustc_query_impl::queries::symbol_name>::compute 10: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 11: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 12: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::force_query_with_job 13: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 14: ::symbol_name 15: rustc_symbol_mangling::test::SymbolNamesTest::process_attrs 16: rustc_hir::hir::Crate::visit_all_item_likes 17: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 18: rustc_symbol_mangling::test::report_symbol_names 19: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 20: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::ongoing_codegen 21: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 22: rustc_span::with_source_map 23: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 24: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.53.0-nightly (74874a690 2021-03-30) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type staticlib query stack during panic: #0 [symbol_name] computing the symbol for `{misc#1}` end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error; 1 warning emitted ```
